messages.subject: Re: First day reflections
messages.msgSnippet: ... starsuncloud@c... wrote: Thanks so much!! What a great article. And you probably didn t know we have a family obsession with India. :-) ... occasions such
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com,
starsuncloud@c... wrote:

Thanks so much!! What a great article. And you probably didn't
know we have a family obsession with India. :-)
>
> Oh yes! Its at our groups website and I keep it in faves for
occasions such
> as these...
>
> http://www.greenstar.org/butterflies/Hole-in-the-Wall.htm

My favorite quote: "I'm not even going to suggest that we use this
[technique] for adults. The only reaction we got from adults was,
"What on earth is this for? Why is there no one here to teach us
something? How are we ever going to use this?" I contend that
by the time we are 16, we are taught to want teachers, taught that
we cannot learn anything without teachers."

Glad to have seen this in advance.

Julie

messages.subject: First day reflections
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/7/03 11:30:21 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/7/03 11:30:21 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
Does anyone here still have the link to the article about the computer set
in the wall in India? That might be a good thing for Julie's family to see
right now!!
>>

Oh yes! Its at our groups website and I keep it in faves for occasions such
as these...

http://www.greenstar.org/butterflies/Hole-in-the-Wall.htm

There you go.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
